title.narrative: Amplifying Voices of Women with disabilities

description.narrative:
Project goal: The overall goal of this intervention is to contribute to improved human rights situations of women with disabilities in Kenya. Specifically the project aims at • Promoting the inclusion and participation of WWDs in decision making and development at national and local levels. • Building of WWDs and their organisations to lobby and advocate their inclusion in decision-making processes. • Establish linkages with Women Rights Organisations. • Work with local and national governments to mainstream disability in policy, law and programmes.
This project is implemented in partnership with Light for the World and Federation of Wome Lawyers (FIDA-Kenya)

Project objectives: 1. To increase visibility and capacities of disabled persons organizations (DPOs) and women with disabilities to effectively represent and advocate for their rights at national and county levels.
2. To work with authorities at all levels to ensure inclusion of rights of women and girls with disabilities in policy framework development and implementation.

Women with disabilities (WWD) in six identified counties where the disability prevalence is quite high as compared to other counties in Kenya. Many WWD lack access to public services and have limited skills to advocate for provision of these services. Women with Disabilities in political positions.

Output 3

description.narrative: 6 grants are provided to DPOs in each county through their peer groups and federations to carry out lobby and advocacy as well as social accountability and oversight activities at all levels of local governance.

title.narrative: Number of advocacy and social accountability actions implemented
Number of peer groups and federations of women and girls with disability receiving grants
The number of functional formal or informal county gender and disability caucus
Proportion of county ministries, departments, boards, committees and semi-autonomous agencies with disability inclusion focal point persons
Evidence of policy or regulatory frameworks resulting from women with disabilities' actions
Number of groups that have passed to level 3 of the 5-C scale
Output 2

description.narrative: 6,000 women with disabilities, their families and care givers in the targeted areas participate in disability, women rights, public participation and social accountability trainings

title.narrative: Number of mentees participating in the mentorship program.
Number of members pf parliament (National Assembly and Senate) and members of county assemblies trained on the rightsof women and girls with disabilities
Evidence of members of parliament (national and senate) using their skills to enact disability inclusive legislation and policys
Number of members of parliament (National Assembly and Senate) and members of county assemblies trained on the rightsof women and girls with disabilities
Number of mentors participating in the mentorship program.
Number of women actually advocating the rights of women with disabilities
Evidence that the elected and appointed members of county assemblies actively participate in policy making processes and effectively represent persons with disabilities.
The number of elected and appointed representatives of persons with disabilities sponsoring bills advancing the rights of women with disabilities in county assemblies
Number of women with disabilities participating in annual CIDP planning, county budget and economic forum, annual plans and budgets discussions and annual national budgeting cycles planning
Output 1

description.narrative: 60 organizations of women with disabilities formed and strengthened at ward and sub county level. They are further supported to form 6 county level federations linked to the UDPK women wing

title.narrative: The number of informal and formal networks, forums and meetings initiated by the women organizations to link and actively engage organizations and networks of women and girls with disabilities at the county and national level.
The number of targeted women organizations that have instituted disability mainstreaming policies and /or actions

Proportion of staff members at different organizational management level in the targeted organization that have demonstrable knowledge and skills on how to mainstream disability in their lobby and advocacy programmes.
Number of leaders trained on disability rights and gender equality.
Number of peer groups with equitable representation of women and caregivers of girls with disabilities based on disability, social status and age

Number of formal and informal peer groups and federations in every county that have put in place institution structures (constitution and resource mobilization plans, L&A-skills and knowledge, tools and processes for accountability role) to ensure that they deliver on their L&A-objectives.
Proportion of policies,legislation and programs by county governments that explicitly address and target persons with disabilities in general and women and girls with disabilities in particular.
Number of proposals made to amend/ enact gvernment bills to incorporate the rights of persons with disabilities in general and women and girls with disabilities in particular
Outcome 2

description.narrative: County governments have more inclusive laws, policies and programmes in paper and practice

title.narrative: Observable changes in policy and practice in key sectors (such as education, health, Social protection and livelihoods) that promote participation of women with disabilities.

actual.value: At national Level: Currently DPOs are involved in reviewing the Social Welfare Act. UDPK has participated in various platforms organized by the Social Protection Actors Forum. This process is ongoing with a new law anticipated to ensure that women and men with disabilities that need social assistance are covered.

title.narrative: Observable changes in policy and practice in key sectors (such as education, health, Social protection and livelihoods) that promote participation of women with disabilities

actual.value: At National Level- Data and Disability: A technical Working group on Disability Data has been launched and officially inducted on its work. This committee includes the techinical team from the KNBS and from the disabilities sector as spearheaded by UDPK. Among the members are women with disabilities. Inclusive Data Charter: One of the commitments made by the Government of Kenya (GOK) during the 2018 Global Disability Summit is on Inclusive data Charter. As part of the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection’s plan to drive forward the Government’s commitment on data for persons with disabilities an IACC forum was held with the aim of deepening the understanding of stakeholders on the Inclusive Data Charter. Specifically the agenda of the meeting covered 1) An overview of the Inclusive Data Charter and GoK’s commitment on data. 2) Presentation on the work of the Inclusive Data Charter. 3) A proposal was made for taking forward Kenya’s Inclusive Data Charter action plan and ICC engagement The International Data Charter (IDC) is part of the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development Data (GPSDD) which is a global mechanism that can be leveraged on to improve the quantity and quality of disaggregation of data and offers an opportunity for countries and organizations signing up as champions to show leadership and commitment to the SDG2030 Leave No One Behind (LNOB) agenda. More information on the Inclusive Data Charter can be found on https://www.data4sdgs.org/inclusivedatacharter
UDPKcommenced engagement with KNBS officials on how to the Washington Module of Capturing disability data in the upcoming 2019 Census.

title.narrative: Milestones realized towards enactment and implementation of inclusive policies and legislations at national and county level as well as in design and implementation of development programmes and projects

actual.value: At National Level: For the first time Kenya - The Washington Module for capturing disability data was employed for the first time in Kenya in the just concluded 2019 Census that was held in August 2019. The census questionnaire included some six key questions that aim to capture certain data as related to persons with limited abilities to function in activities of daily life.

• Women with disabilities agenda included in report of survey conducted by Department of Health in Laikipia County •Organizations of women with disabilities and Peer advisors in Homabay County were included as part of the stakeholders that drafted and formulated the County Disability Bill. The bill has gone through the various processes within the county legislative processes. The bill was recently gazetted that marked its culmination into an Act that would serve Persons with Disabilities within the county of Homabay. • Collaborations between women DPOs county Caucus and County officials in Kakamega led to leaders in the drafting of Disability Policy. • Also Kakamega County Disability Bill 2019 is now in the assembly for debating. Before the bill went to the assembly persons with disabilities give their views at a public participation forum in December 2019• Lobbied County government to conduct a Disability Survey in 2019- spearheaded by the Ministry of Social Services. • One lady with a disability from Mumius Sub-county sits in the County Education Board; where she chairs the subcommittee on special needs education whose role is to follow up and ensure assessment and enrolement of children with disabilities support special education units in mainstream schools get the support they need. Support special education schools to be linked to regular schools as a way of enhancing inclusive education

title.narrative: Outcome 1

description.narrative: Increased number of women with disabilities accessing public services at the county and national level

title.narrative: Number of women with disabilities with knowledge on disability and women rights, advocacy, lobbying, public participation and social accountability

Evidence that new sector level legislations, policies, programmes and strategies in the target counties include disability and gender equality objectives and activities to address barriers faced by women with disabilities
